subject: Leadership
title: Storytelling in Presentations
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Storytelling in Presentations.

hook.text: Steve Jobs didn't launch the iPhone with specs. He told the story of three devices becoming one. The crowd went wild.

buildup.text: Stories make presentations memorable. Data fades; stories stick. The best speakers are the best storytellers.

discovery.text: Nancy Duarte studied great speeches and found a pattern: alternate between what is and what could be. Create contrast.

twist.text: Leaders fear stories waste time. The opposite is true. A 60-second story often conveys more than ten minutes of slides.

climax.text: Every presentation needs one story. Structure it: relatable character, specific challenge, surprising resolution.

quiz.question: What pattern did Nancy Duarte find in great speeches?
options: Alternating between what is and what could be
Using as many statistics as possible
